title: small improvements
body:
Hello,

Here are a few small improvements
- Rcsslegend should now works like legend when x is a text : for instance `Rcsslegend("topright", legend=c("foo", "bar"))` was not working but now it should.
- Similarly, Rcssplot now works even if y is missing
- It is now possible to set a parameter to NA
- Added additional wrappers (Rcssgrid and Rcssmatplot)

cheers

title: Wrapper + Dryer refactor
body: I think I have it fixed now, also copied the getting started plots into a vignette so I can test faster.

title: Wrapper refactor + dryer
body:
This should finish up the wrapper refactor, which eliminates nearly all of the duplicated code. It also provides a `dryer()` function to easily add a style sheet to a pre-written block of base R graphics code. 

NAMESPACE and a RcssWrappers.Rd file are now both being correctly generated by Roxygen.

title: Rcssplot and Rcsshist produce same title and labels than plot and hist
body:
Hello,

I have modified the code of Rcssplot and Rcsshist in order to make these functions behave behave more like plot and hist. Especially, titles and labels should be the same.

title: Define a default style object
body:
Hello,

Here is a simple modification that allow to define a default Rcss style object, so that you do not need to repeat "Rccs=mystyle" in each graphic function. For instance, instead of:

``` r
myStyle <- Rcss("myStyle.Rcss")
Rcssplot(rnorm(10), Rcss=myStyle)
Rcssabline(h=0, Rcss=myStyle)
Rcsstitle("Random plot", Rcss=myStyle)
```

you can write:

``` r
Rcss("myStyle.Rcss", default=TRUE)
Rcssplot(rnorm(10))
Rcssabline(h=0)
Rcsstitle("Random plot")
```

When the user loads the package, an empty style object is set as default style, so the tests "if (is.null(Rcss)) are not needed anymore.

Finally, I have replaced the "paste0...eval(parse(..." by "do.call". It's a base function that calls a function and passes it the elements of a lists as parameters: `do.call(foo, list(x=1, y=2))` is equivalent to `foo(x=1, y=2)`

Cheers

title: Changing PSZ to paste0
body:
Saw Rcssplot on Rbloggers, seems like a really good idea. I'm going to try it out at work.

Anyway, was looking through your code, saw PSZ, I think you should just use paste0 instead, unless you are trying to run your package on a super old version of R.

Cheers!
